questions.question_text: Which of the following security risks can be reduced by a properly configured network firewall?

discussion.content:
Firewalls can be configured to detect and block suspicious traffic patterns associated with DoS attacks, thereby preventing or minimizing the impact of such attacks on the network.
C. Denial of service (DoS) attacks

Clustering involves grouping multiple servers together to work as a unified system, providing redundancy and failover capabilities. By implementing clustering, the organization can distribute the workload across multiple servers and ensure high availability. In the event of a server failure, the workload can automatically be shifted to other servers in the cluster, minimizing downtime and maintaining service continuity.

Selected Answer: B
clustering, put them in one place

questions.question_text: An IS auditor learns the organization has experienced several server failures in its distributed environment. Which of the following is the BEST recommendation to limit the potential impact of server failures in the future?
Which of the following is the BEST source of information for assessing the effectiveness of IT process monitoring?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
While real-time audit software (option D) may provide valuable insights into the compliance and security posture of IT processes, it typically focuses on specific audit objectives rather than providing comprehensive performance data for assessing overall process effectiveness. Performance data, on the other hand, offers a broader perspective on IT process performance and is directly relevant to evaluating the effectiveness of IT process monitoring initiatives. Therefore, performance data is the BEST source of information for assessing the effectiveness of IT process monitoring.

Performance data is considered the best source of information for assessing the effectiveness of IT process monitoring because it provides objective and quantifiable evidence of the efficiency and effectiveness of the processes being monitored. Performance data can include metrics such as processing times, resource utilization, error rates, and more. By analyzing performance data, IT teams can identify areas where processes can be improved, determine if IT resources are being used optimally, and make data-driven decisions about process monitoring and improvement. In contrast, participative management techniques, quality assurance (QA) reviews, and real-time audit software may provide useful information, but performance data is the most direct and tangible measure of process effectiveness.

choices.C: Restoring system information from data backups
choices.B: Generating automated batch job failure notifications
choices.D: Employing only qualified personnel to execute tasks
choices.A: Utilizing processes that enforce segmentation of duties

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a corrective control?

discussion.content: C. Restoring system information from data backups
C. Average time to turn strategic IT objectives into an agreed upon and approved initiative

questions.question_text: Which of the following metrics would BEST measure the agility of an organization's IT function?

choices.C: Average time to turn strategic IT objectives into an agreed upon and approved initiative
choices.B: Percentage of staff with sufficient IT-related skills for the competency required of their roles
choices.D: Frequency of security assessments against the most recent standards and guidelines
choices.A: Average number of learning and training hours per IT staff member
